snippet: The defendant, Ahmed Abassi, 27, had been secretly recorded discussing his terrorism-related aspirations, including a proposal to contaminate the air or water with bacteria.
abstract: Ahmed Abassi, Tunisian man accused of engaging in terrorist acts against targets in United States and other countries, is sentenced in Manhattan to time he has served in prison since his arrest in 2013; he plead guilty to lesser charges in June and will be deported.
lead_paragraph: The defendant, Ahmed Abassi, 27, had been secretly recorded discussing his terrorism-related aspirations, including a proposal to contaminate the air or water with bacteria.

headline.main: Tunisian Whom U.S. Accused of Plotting Terrorist Acts Is Sentenced to Time Served
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Terror Case Sentenced to Time Served
